title: Lyft CEO and president to step down, former Amazon exec David Risher named as replacement
description: Lyft's cofounders, Logan Green and John Zimmer, will step back from their day-to-day roles as CEO and president, with David Risher as the new CEO.

title: A deadline looms for rules governing deep-sea mining, but a rushed decision may be risky
description: The conversation about regulating deep-sea mining in international waters has become especially urgent ahead of a rulemaking deadline.

title: Jay-Z is now worth $2.5 billion—Warren Buffett once said 'he's the guy to learn from'
description: The Brooklyn-born artist became rap's first billionaire back in 2019.

title: Bitcoin falls after CFTC sues crypto exchange Binance for allegedly breaking trading rules
description: Bitcoin is still on track to cap a winning month. It's advanced 16% in March, while ether has gained 6%.

title: Alibaba founder Jack Ma back in China after months abroad in sign Beijing may be warming to tech
description: Alibaba founder Jack Ma has been spotted in China in a potential sign that Beijing is warming to technology giants again after a crackdown on the sector.

title: Disney layoffs will begin this week, CEO Bob Iger says in memo
description: Disney CEO Bob Iger notified employees in a memo that job losses will begin this week.

title: Israel's Netanyahu to delay judiciary overhaul after mass protests, coalition partner says
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Monday agreed to suspend a planned judiciary reform until the next parliament session after nationwide protests paralyzed the country.

title: Binance and founder Changpeng Zhao violated compliance rules to attract U.S. users, CFTC alleges
description: The CFTC alleged that Binance violated federal law to solicit U.S. users for millions in revenue, a potentially existential threat to the exchange.

title: Lebanon wakes up in two simultaneous time zones as government can't agree on daylight saving change
description: The disagreement has led to chaos and confusion for airports, businesses, and people across Lebanon.

title: Huawei reportedly says it has developed domestic chip design tools despite U.S. sanctions
description: Huawei along with other domestic firms, created electronic chip design tools required to make semiconductors at 14 nanometers and above, a top exec said.

title: Starlink rival OneWeb aims for global satellite internet coverage after passing a key milestone
description: Internet satellite company OneWeb is aiming to roll out coverage globally after successfully launching an additional 36 satellites Sunday.

title: Humza Yousaf wins leadership election of Scotland’s ruling party, set to lead the country
description: Humza Yousaf has been elected the new head of the Scottish National Party by party members.

title: Angry protests, strikes paralyze Israel as Netanyahu resists pausing widely hated judicial reforms
description: Mass protests have erupted in Israel in recent months over controversial judicial reforms pushed by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's government.

title: Saudi National Bank chair resigns just days after Credit Suisse comments sparked sell-off
description: Al-Khudairy's resignation comes days after his comments fueled investor panic and contributed to a selloff in the shares of embattled lender Credit Suisse.

title: Lebanon wakes up in two simultaneous times zones as government can't agree on daylight savings change
description: The disagreement has led to chaos and confusion for airports, businesses, and people across Lebanon.

title: Club Med owner is bullish on China's reopening, says resort is ‘definitely not for sale'
description: Club Med is "very optimistic" about China's reopening, and says the luxury resort chain is "definitely not for sale," an executive from Fosun Tourism Group told CNBC.

title: CNBC Daily Open: SVB deposits and loans find a buyer
description: First Citizens bank agreed to buy Silicon Valley Bank’s deposits and loans, suggesting there is still confidence in the U.S. banking sector.

title: 'The first bank crisis of the Twitter generation': The pressure on banks is very different to 2008
description: Credit Suisse and Silicon Valley Bank may have collapsed but a financial crash today would be very different to the 2008 crisis.

title: Worried about your kids and A.I.? Experts share advice — and highlight the risks to look out for
description: AI is all the rage, but there are concerns it could be a double-edged sword, especially when it comes to kids. Experts tell CNBC Make It how to mitigate them.

title: Germany is overhauling its immigration rules to bolster a rapidly shrinking workforce
description: Germany is poised to pass a new nationality law that will make it easier for foreigners to gain citizenship.

title: First Citizens Bank to buy Silicon Valley Bank deposits and loans
description: First Citizens Bank agreed to buy Silicon Valley Bank's deposits and loans, the U.S. Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation said Monday.

title: Fed's Kashkari says stress in banking sector brings the U.S. closer to recession
description: Recent banking turmoil could bring the U.S. closer to a recession, Minneapolis Fed President Neel Kashkari said in an interview with CBS' "Face The Nation."

title: Pfizer signs agreement with China on improving health coverage in the country
description: U.S. pharma giant Pfizer has signed an agreement with China to cooperate on improving the country's health coverage, according to the company.

title: China's debt-heavy local governments look for new ways to raise cash
description: Debt-heavy local governments in China need new ways to raise money under a central regime keen on reducing financial risks.
